metadata.Title: CVE-2021-4122 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
decryption through LUKS2 reencryption crash recovery

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-4122` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cryptsetup - 2:2.3.7-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
cryptsetup-bin - 2:2.3.7-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
cryptsetup-initramfs - 2:2.3.7-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
cryptsetup-run - 2:2.3.7-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
libcryptsetup12 - 2:2.3.7-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: amurray> Vulnerability is in the online re-encryption feature which is only supported by cryptsetup >= 2.2.0 mdeslaur> per upstream, the backport to 2.2 would be very problematic and it is suggested that the best option is to disable online reencryption

criterions.comment: cryptsetup package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:2.3.7-0ubuntu0.21.10.1').
